content.rendered:
Photo by SplitShire

This Week in Genesis I’m excited to bring you:

  • two new premium Genesis themes
  • the finest showcase sites (since last week)
  • a handy new Genesis resource from Sridhar
  • more tutorials than you’ll know what to do with
  • and, your chance to try Know The Code for free!

Let’s get this party started.

Themes

I believe it was consistently one of the top selling themes on StudioPress in its day and now the all new Epik theme is here from appfinite.

The New Epik Theme is here with a fresh look & plenty of features! – https://t.co/GAwBLFlFra #genesiswp #wordpress pic.twitter.com/0hUKzKpfXD

— appfinite (@appfinite) July 20, 2016

A new theme aimed at lawyers from the prolific Web Savvy Marketing this week, entitled Richard.

New #GenesisWP theme: Richard is a law firm #WordPress theme with oodles of functionality. https://t.co/Fw2BaYzoPN pic.twitter.com/T6nl0K3ow7

— Web Savvy Marketing (@WebSavvyMrkting) July 20, 2016

Showcase

First up, a great new Genesis site (and interesting new service) from Dave Dean, getshopmonster.com

Because Twitter garbled my last tweet, here's the proper link to ShopMonster, built with #genesiswp – https://t.co/LXM9WNv22E

— Dave Dean (@wpmusketeer) July 20, 2016

And two new sites from either the most organised or most workaholic man in Genesis, the uber productive, Shaan Nicol. First up with identifytech.com (nice slow motion vid)…

Identify Tech

…and edune.com

EDUNE

Next up, a nice use of Themedy’s Brisket ‘restaurant theme’ for serenedreams.com

Thought our Brisket theme was just for restaurants? Nope. See: https://t.co/ddr8beE6vh by @aprilzubko #thesiswp #genesiswp

— Themedy Team (@themedythemes) July 19, 2016

Best of the rest

Sridhar’s never short of a helping hand or good idea as far as the Genesis community is concerned and this week is no exception with the launch of a new Genesis search on his site.

A single Search across several Genesis resources: https://t.co/EntceWVm4A#GenesisWP

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) July 21, 2016

The legend that is Sal Ferrarello did a talk on ‘Hooked on Genesis’ at WordPress Lancaster and kindly shared his slides!

I enjoyed talking about #genesiswp at @WPLanc tonight. Here is a link to my slides https://t.co/fBkHeDmx8V

— Sal Ferrarello (@salcode) July 21, 2016

Tonya Mork continues to go deep and I mean deep into WordPress (especially Genesis, currently) learning, rolling out an impressive 14 hours of video in her Custom Developer’s Starter Theme series.

Hey #GenesisWP, I just finished the entire Custom Developer's Starter Theme series for you. over 14 hrs & 104 videos https://t.co/ZmFaqhb3Wr

— Tonya Mork (@hellofromTonya) July 22, 2016

She’s also now offering a free trial on all new KnowTheCode memberships so you can test the water first (though I reckon you’ll like it just fine).

Announcements: we are now offering a (free) trial period with each Pro membership.

Come. Try us out. Advance your career. #wordpress

— Know The Code (@KnowTheCodePro) July 16, 2016

Jamie Mitchell is sharing a few Genesis snippets.

Free #genesiswp code snippets https://t.co/5j1pGSVS2P

— Jamie Mitchell (@jamiejmitchell) July 20, 2016

Ryan Rudolph has a simple but useful tutorial for you, Adding featured images behind page titles.

Simple #genesiswp tutorial – Add featured images behind page titles. https://t.co/X0UeGh78tu

— Ryan Rudolph (@ryancrudolph) July 15, 2016

Chinmoy Paul has been rocking out new material like a boss.

How to add a sliding horizontal email subscription form above the site header https://t.co/P0wOOq3eQe #genesiswp #wordpress

— Genesis Developer (@genesisdevelopr) July 19, 2016

How to add expend/collapse effect in WordPress Categories widget? #genesiswp #wordpress https://t.co/kdFMAg3gef

— Genesis Developer (@genesisdevelopr) July 17, 2016

How do you display more than 4 related products on products view page #genesiswp #wordpress #woocommerce https://t.co/YcSG9WrhcZ

— Genesis Developer (@genesisdevelopr) July 22, 2016

And, if you’re in the UK and you’re going to WordCamp Brighton, there’s a meetup happening today (this Friday) evening at 6:30pm.

Any #genesiswp peeps coming to WordCamp Brighton #wcbtn? Meet us at the Prince George at 6:30pm Friday https://t.co/gJzsnFyPNu

— UK Genesis (@UKGenesis) July 19, 2016

And finally…

If you have a spare minute this Friday why not hop on over to the StudioPress forums and see if you can help anybody, like Susan.

When I have some downtime, I like to respond to unanswered posts in the @studiopress community forums. You should too! #genesiswp

— Susan Ramsey (@onehappystudio) July 16, 2016

That’s all for this week, I’m off for a haircut.

I hope you have a good weekend (haircut or otherwise) and I’ll see you all again very soon.

PS Did you know that with every new subscriber I gain even more evil energy to bring future editions of This Week in Genesis to you? So if you don’t already, make a man happy (you want me to be happy, right?) and subscribe below now. (You rock).

excerpt.rendered: Two new premium Genesis themes, a cool new Genesis resource, and try Know The Code for free.
